com.myscript.atk.sltw

Interface SingleLineWidgetApi


  • public interface SingleLineWidgetApi
    This interface describes the public API of the single line widget.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnConfiguredListener
      Called when handwriting configuration ends.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnEraseGestureListener
      Called when an erase gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnInsertGestureListener
      Called when an insert gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnJoinGestureListener
      Called when a join gesture is detected.

      Called when a long press gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnOverwriteGestureListener
      Called when an overwrite gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnPenAbortListener
      Called when the user aborts writing.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnPenDownListener
      Called when the user starts writing.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnPenMoveListener
      Called when the user is writing.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnPenUpListener
      Called when the user ends writing.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnReturnGestureListener
      Called when a return gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnSelectGestureListener
      Called when a select gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnSingleTapGestureListener
      Called when a single tap gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener
      Called when the text changes.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnUnderlineGestureListener
      Called when an underline gesture is detected.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnUserScrollBeginListener
      Called when the user starts scrolling the widget manually.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnUserScrollEndListener
      Called when the user finishes scrolling the widget manually.
      static interface  SingleLineWidgetApi.OnUserScrollListener
      Called when the user is scrolling the widget manually.

    • Method Detail

      • registerCertificate

        boolean registerCertificate(byte[] certificate)
        Register MyScript engine certificate and return true on success, false on failure.
        Parameters:
        certificate - The MyScript engine certificate.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure.

      • setStrokeLayerType

        void setStrokeLayerType(int type)
        Set the type of layer backing for stroke views of the widget. The layer can be either:
        • LAYER_TYPE_NONE
        • LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE
        • LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
        The widget does not use any backing layer by default for stroke views. Hardware layer can be used to slightly improve smoothness of the rendering, at the expense of higher GPU memory consumption.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of layer to use for stroke views of the widget.

      • getStrokeLayerType

        int getStrokeLayerType()
        Return the type of layer backing for stroke views of the widget.
        Returns:
        The type of layer used for stroke views of the widget.

      • setInkColor

        void setInkColor(int color)
        Set the color of the ink.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the ink.

      • getInkColor

        int getInkColor()
        Return the color of the ink.
        Returns:
        Color of the ink.

      • setInkWidth

        void setInkWidth(float width)
        Set the width of the ink.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the ink in pixels.

      • getInkWidth

        float getInkWidth()
        Return the width of the ink.
        Returns:
        Width of the ink in pixels.

      • setLongPressDelay

        void setLongPressDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which long press event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        delay - Long press delay in milliseconds or -1 to revert to default value.

      • getLongPressDelay

        int getLongPressDelay()
        Return the delay after which long press event is triggered.
        Returns:
        Long press delay in milliseconds.

      • setWordCandidateListSize

        void setWordCandidateListSize(int size)
        Set maximum number of word candidates. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        size - Maximum number of word candidates or -1 to use value set in the .conf configuration file.

      • getWordCandidateListSize

        int getWordCandidateListSize()
        Return maximum number of word candidates.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of word candidates or -1 if using value set in the .conf configuration file.

      • setCharacterCandidateListSize

        void setCharacterCandidateListSize(int size)
        Set maximum number of character candidates. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        size - Maximum number of character candidates or -1 to use value set in the .conf configuration file.

      • getCharacterCandidateListSize

        int getCharacterCandidateListSize()
        Return maximum number of character candidates.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of character candidates or -1 if using value set in the .conf configuration file.

      • setSpeedQualityCompromise

        void setSpeedQualityCompromise(int value)
        Set speed/quality compromise rating. Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        value - Speed/quality compromise rating or -1 to use value set in the .conf configuration file.

        Higher value gives better accuracy but reduces recognition speed. Lower value improves recognition speed but accuracy is lower.

      • getSpeedQualityCompromise

        int getSpeedQualityCompromise()
        Return speed/quality compromise rating.
        Returns:
        Speed/quality compromise rating or -1 if using value set in the .conf configuration file. value is between 0 and 255.
        See Also:
        setSpeedQualityCompromise(int)

      • setUserLexicon

        void setUserLexicon(List<String> lexicon)
        Set user lexicon (array of words). Widget must be configured again for this setting to take effect.
        Parameters:
        lexicon - Array of user-defined words.

      • getUserLexicon

        List<String> getUserLexicon()
        Return user lexicon (array of words).
        Returns:
        Array of user-defined words.

      • enableGesture

        void enableGesture(int gesture)
        Enable detection of the specified gesture. Several gestures may be enabled at once by combining several gesture flags using an OR operation.
        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture(s) to enable. Available gestures:
        • all gestures (ALL_GESTURES),
        • single tap (GESTURE_SINGLE_TAP),
        • long press (GESTURE_LONG_PRESS),
        • return (GESTURE_RETURN),
        • erase (GESTURE_ERASE),
        • select (GESTURE_SELECT),
        • underline (GESTURE_UNDERLINE),
        • join (GESTURE_JOIN),
        • insert (GESTURE_INSERT),
        • overwrite (GESTURE_OVERWRITE).

      • disableGesture

        void disableGesture(int gesture)
        Disable detection of the specified gesture. Several gestures may be disabled at once by combining several gesture flags using an OR operation.
        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture(s) to disable.
        See Also:
        enableGesture(int)

      • isGestureEnabled

        boolean isGestureEnabled(int gesture)
        Return whether specified gesture is enabled.
        Parameters:
        gesture - Gesture flag.
        Returns:
        true if gesture is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setTypeface

        void setTypeface(Typeface typeface)
        Set the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed.
        Parameters:
        typeface - The Typeface to use for the text.

      • getTypeface

        Typeface getTypeface()
        Return the typeface in which the text should be displayed.
        Returns:
        Typeface object.

      • setTextSize

        void setTextSize(float size)
        Set the size of the text and disable automatic font size selection.
        Parameters:
        size - Size of the text in pixels.
        See Also:
        setTextSizes(float[])

      • setTextSizes

        void setTextSizes(float[] sizes)
        Set the range of allowed text sizes used for automatic font size selection.
        Parameters:
        sizes - Range of allowed text sizes or null to revert to the default range.

      • getTextSizes

        float[] getTextSizes()
        Return the range of allowed text sizes used for automatic font size selection.
        Returns:
        Range of allowed text sizes.

      • setTextColor

        void setTextColor(int color)
        Set the color of the text for all the states (normal, selected) to be this color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the text for all the states.

        By default the text colors are the ones define by the application theme defined in the manifest.

        See Also:
        setTextColors(ColorStateList)

      • setTextColors

        void setTextColors(ColorStateList colors)
        Set the colors of the text for the different states (normal, selected).
        Parameters:
        colors - List of colors for various states. Two states are defined for the text: EMPTY_STATE_SET and SELECTED_STATE_SET

        By default the ColorStateList is the one define by the application theme defined in the manifest.

      • getTextColors

        ColorStateList getTextColors()
        Return the colors of the text for the different states (normal, selected).
        Returns:
        List of colors for various states.

      • setTextMargin

        void setTextMargin(float margin)
        Set the text margin before the text.
        Parameters:
        margin - Text margin before the text in pixels.

      • getTextMargin

        float getTextMargin()
        Return the text margin before the text.
        Returns:
        Text margin before the text in pixels.

      • setWritingAreaBackground

        void setWritingAreaBackground(Drawable drawable)
        Set the background of the writing area to the given drawable.
        Parameters:
        drawable - Drawable of the background or null to remove the background of the writing area.

      • setWritingAreaBackgroundColor

        color - Color of the background.

        Parameters:

        Return the background of the writing area.
        Returns:
        Drawable background of the writing area.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the baseline in pixels.

      • getBaselinePosition

        Return the position of the baseline from the top of the writing area.
        Returns:
        Position of the baseline in pixels.

      • setBaselineThickness

        Set the thickness of the baseline.
        Parameters:

      • getBaselineThickness

      • setAutoScrollEnabled

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        setAutoScrollDelay(int), setAutoScrollDelays(int, int)

      • isAutoScrollEnabled

        boolean isAutoScrollEnabled()
        Return whether auto-scroll is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the widget shall scroll automatically after a delay, false otherwise.

      • setAutoScrollDelay

        void setAutoScrollDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which the writing area scrolls automatically once the user has finished writing.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setAutoScrollDelays(int, int)

      • setAutoScrollDelays

        void setAutoScrollDelays(int delayWhenNearlyEmpty,
                         int delayWhenNearlyFull)
        Set parameters of the auto-scroll delay. The writing area scrolls automatically after a delay once the user has finished writing. This delay is computed from the nearly full / nearly empty delay values provided to this method.

        After each stroke, the widget computes the amount of visible space left on the screen and available for writing. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full, the widget will compute a scroll delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyFull value. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty, the widget will compute a scroll delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyEmpty value. In-between delay values are computed if the visible portion of the writing area is half full.

        Typically, leaving delays as their default values, the widget scrolls the writing area automatically after a long delay if there is a lot of space available for writing. The widget scrolls the writing area automatically after a short delay if there is little space available for writing.

        Parameters:
        delayWhenNearlyEmpty - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty.
        delayWhenNearlyFull - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full.

      • getAutoScrollDelayWhenNearlyEmpty

        int getAutoScrollDelayWhenNearlyEmpty()
        Return the delay after which the widget scrolls automatically when the writing area is nearly empty.
        Returns:
        Delay in milliseconds.

      • getAutoScrollDelayWhenNearlyFull

        int getAutoScrollDelayWhenNearlyFull()
        Return the delay after which the widget scrolls automatically when the writing area is nearly full.
        Returns:
        Delay in milliseconds.

      • setAutoTypesetEnabled

        void setAutoTypesetEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether the widget turns ink into typeset letters automatically.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the widget shall typeset (turn ink into characters) automatically after a delay, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setAutoTypesetDelay(int)

      • isAutoTypesetEnabled

        boolean isAutoTypesetEnabled()
        Return whether auto-typeset is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the widget shall scroll turn ink into characters (typeset) automatically after a delay, false otherwise.

      • setAutoTypesetDelay

        void setAutoTypesetDelay(int delay)
        Set delay after which the widget turns ink into typeset letters automatically.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setAutoTypesetDelays(int, int)

      • setAutoTypesetDelays

        void setAutoTypesetDelays(int delayWhenNearlyEmpty,
                          int delayWhenNearlyFull)
        Set parameters of the auto-typeset delay. The widget turns ink into characters (typesets) automatically after a delay once the user has finished writing. This delay is computed from the nearly full / nearly empty delay values provided to this method.

        After each stroke, the widget computes the amount of visible space left on the screen and available for writing. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full, the widget will compute a typeset delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyFull value. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty, the widget will compute a typeset delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyEmpty value. In-between delay values are computed if the visible portion of the writing area is half full.

        Typically, leaving delays as their default values, the widget triggers a typeset of the ink after a short delay if there is a lot of space available for writing. The widget triggers a typeset of the ink after a long delay if there is little space available for writing.

        Parameters:
        delayWhenNearlyEmpty - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty.
        delayWhenNearlyFull - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full.

      • getAutoTypesetDelayWhenNearlyEmpty

        int getAutoTypesetDelayWhenNearlyEmpty()
        Return the delay after which the widget turns ink into characters when the writing area is nearly empty.
        Returns:
        Delay in milliseconds.

      • getAutoTypesetDelayWhenNearlyFull

        int getAutoTypesetDelayWhenNearlyFull()
        Return the delay after which the widget turns ink into characters when the writing area is nearly full.
        Returns:
        Delay in milliseconds.

      • setTransientSpaceEnabled

        void setTransientSpaceEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable transient space feature. A space mark is shown right after the content in the baseline, as a dashed line. This space mark is called transient space.

        If the user writes into the transient space area, the space mark disappears and this indicates that no space shall be added between the actual content and what the user is writing. If the user writes beyond the transient space area, a space character shall be added by the widget between the actual content and what the user is writing.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if transient space feature is enabled, false otherwise.

      • isTransientSpaceEnabled

        boolean isTransientSpaceEnabled()
        Return whether transient space feature is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if transient space feature is enabled, false otherwise.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear ink and text contained in the widget.

        Set the text managed by this widget.
        Parameters:
        text - String representation of the text (may be null).
        See Also:
        SingleLineWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener

      • getText

        String getText()
        Return the text managed by this widget.
        Returns:
        String representation of the text.

      • replaceCharacters

        boolean replaceCharacters(int start,
                          int end,
                          String text)
        Replace characters in the text. This method can be used to select an alternate handwriting recognition candidate for any word or character. The specified character range shall span a word or a single character, and the provided replacement text shall be one of the possible candidates to trigger a word or character candidate change.

        Characters may be inserted at any location in the text by calling this method with the same start and end character indices and a non-empty replacement string.

        Characters may be deleted from the text by calling this method with a non-empty characters range and an empty or null replacement string.

        Parameters:
        start - Character index of the first character to replace.
        end - Character index past the last character to replace.
        text - Replacement text string (may be null).
        Returns:
        true if the operation has been applied, false if the index range is invalid or the widget is busy processing.
        See Also:
        SingleLineWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener, getWordCandidates(int), getCharacterCandidates(int)

      • getWordCandidates

        com.myscript.atk.text.CandidateInfo getWordCandidates(int index)
        Return alternate candidate info for the word at specified index. This method computes the character range of the word at specified index, and provides alternate candidates.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) method with parameters from the candidate information object.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the word.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the word at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • getCharacterCandidates

        com.myscript.atk.text.CandidateInfo getCharacterCandidates(int index)
        Return alternate candidate info for the character at specified index. This method computes the character range of the character at specified index, and provides alternate candidates.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) method with parameters from the candidate information object.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the character.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the character at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • clearSearchPath

        void clearSearchPath()
        Clear handwriting resources search path.

      • addSearchDir

        void addSearchDir(String directoryName)
        Add given directory to handwriting resources search path. Directory name can point to a folder in the file system, or to a directory in a zip file. Handwriting resources can be loaded directly from the assets folder of an apk file, as shown below. 
           widget.addSearchDir("zip://" + getContext().getPackageCodePath() + "!/assets/conf");
        Parameters:
        directoryName - Path to a folder containing handwriting resources.

      • configure

        void configure(String bundleName,
               String configName)
        Configure handwriting recognition engine. This method is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the handwriting resources to be configured. It is recommended to setup a configuration listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        When the device is rotated, Android completely recreates the UI without restarting the process of the application. After the device has been rotated, you need to configure the new instance of SingleLineWidgetApi by calling this method again.

        Open the .conf file to see examples of bundleName and configName.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Name of the configuration bundle (for example, "en-US").
        configName - Name of the configuration mode (for example, "text").
        See Also:
        clearSearchPath(), addSearchDir(String), SingleLineWidgetApi.OnConfiguredListener

      • getErrorCode

        int getErrorCode()
        Return an error code describing the last configuration error.
        Returns:
        Error code describing the error or 0 if no error.

      • getErrorString

        String getErrorString()
        Return a string describing the last configuration error.
        Returns:
        String describing the error.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Manually dispose all resources created by this widget. The widget must not be used after this method is called, any call to widget methods will raise a java.lang.IllegalStateException.

      • smoothScrollToCursor

        void smoothScrollToCursor()
        Scroll smoothly the writing area, if needed, so that the cursor is visible. The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • scrollToCursor

        void scrollToCursor()
        Scroll the writing area, if needed, so that the cursor is visible. The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • smoothScrollTo

        void smoothScrollTo(int index)
        Scroll smoothly the writing area to the given character index. The widget defines margins on each side of the screen that are used to clamp the position of the cursor handle while scrolling. When the handle hits the left margin and the writing area can scroll left, the handle remains at the boundary of the left margin and the widget starts to scroll left. Same thing for the right margin.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the left scroll margin, for left-to-right languages. For right-to-left languages, the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the right scroll margin.

        The widget does not scroll if it is already scrolled all the way to the left or to the right and the requested character index is visible. Also, the widget does not scroll if the requested character index is already visible and is not inside the left or right scroll margins.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to scroll to.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • scrollTo

        void scrollTo(int index)
        Scroll the writing area to the given character index. The widget defines margins on each side of the screen that are used to clamp the position of the cursor handle while scrolling. When the handle hits the left margin and the writing area can scroll left, the handle remains at the boundary of the left margin and the widget starts to scroll left. Same thing for the right margin.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the left scroll margin, for left-to-right languages. For right-to-left languages, the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the right scroll margin.

        The widget does not scroll if it is already scrolled all the way to the left or to the right and the requested character index is visible. Also, the widget does not scroll if the requested character index is already visible and is not inside the left or right scroll margins.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to scroll to.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • smoothCenterTo

        void smoothCenterTo(int index)
        Center smoothly the writing area around the given character index. The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is located at the center of the screen, if possible.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to put at the center of the screen.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • centerTo

        void centerTo(int index)
        Center the writing area around the given character index. The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is located at the center of the screen, if possible.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to put at the center of the screen.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • isUserScrolling

        boolean isUserScrolling()
        Indicates whether the user is currently scrolling the writing area. This method returns true only if the widget is scrolling in response to the user scrolling via the scrollbar. This method returns false if the widget is currently scrolling due to auto-scrolling or in response of any of the scrolling methods.
        Returns:
        true if the user the currently scrolling the writing area using the scrollbar, false otherwise.

      • setCursorIndex

        void setCursorIndex(int index)
        Set the position of the cursor. Positioning the cursor inside the text selects the word at the position of the cursor. Moving the cursor out of the bounds of the text (i.e. at a negative index or past the length of the text) hides the cursor and clears the selection.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the cursor.
        See Also:
        smoothScrollToCursor()

      • getCursorIndex

        int getCursorIndex()
        Return the position of the cursor.
        Returns:
        Character index of the cursor.

      • moveCursorToVisibleIndex

        boolean moveCursorToVisibleIndex()
        Move the cursor, if needed, to an index that is visible to the user.
        Returns:
        true if the cursor was actually moved, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getCursorIndex()

      • clearSelection

        void clearSelection()
        Clear the current text selection.

      • selectWord

        void selectWord(int index)
        Select the word at given index. Selecting a portion of text clears the current selection and paints the word at given index using the selection color. Only typeset characters can be selected, this method has no effect on ink. Selected words are shown in selection color once they become typeset.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the word.
        See Also:
        setTextColors(ColorStateList), getSelectionIndex()

      • selectCharacter

        void selectCharacter(int index)
        Select the character at given index. Selecting a portion of text clears the current selection and paints the character at given index using the selection color. Only typeset characters can be selected, this method has no effect on ink. Selected characters are shown in selection color once they become typeset.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the character.
        See Also:
        setTextColors(ColorStateList), getSelectionIndex()

      • getSelectionIndex

        int getSelectionIndex()
        Return the current selection index.
        Returns:
        Character index of the selection index.
